title: Drawing, "Section of a Parliament Building or Academy", 1800–25
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray and pink wash, black chalk on paper
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Section a horizontal building.  The vaulted assembly room is at the right. The vaulted ceiling is decorated with figures and festoons.   At the left, are the ground floor with the entrance hall and the stairway as well as the upper gallery.  In the hall and upper gallery, statues on pedestals are placed against the walls.  In front of the building, at left, is a seated statue.  The portico and the balcony are at the rear facade.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Section of a Parliament Building or Academy", 1800–25.
1800–25. Pen and black ink, brush and gray and pink wash, black chalk on paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-458.
